metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0840 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
tables/apr_hash.c in the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library through1.4.5 computes hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hashcollisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause adenial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an applicationthat maintains a hash table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapr1 - 1.4.6-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apr package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1').
